definition: to scribble rapidly
sickness/disease/hate/envy/swift
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
book/letter/document/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]/to write
to write at a tremendous speed

sentences.english: He sped his pen to complete his novel.
sentences.chinese: 他奋笔疾书来完成他的小说。

sentences.english: He's been pegging away at his work for many years.
sentences.chinese: 他奋笔疾书已经好几年了。

sentences.english: In China they wrote the most in the times when they most needed to redefine themselves.
sentences.chinese: 在中国，人们在需要重新定义自己时会奋笔疾书。

sentences.english: Legions of brave women wrote and lectured for change.
sentences.chinese: 众多富于胆识的女性为变革奋笔疾书，登上讲坛。

sentences.english: He sped his pen across the page.

definition: to write at a tremendous speed
to take up one's pen/to start to write
to write or draw with a brush/to put pen to paper/to write
to finish (a letter, a painting) at a stroke
to bend over one's desk (writing, studying, taking a nap etc)
draft paper
to put pen to paper/pen mark
to dip the pen into ink/to write
writing desk/official record
writing brush/CL:枝[zhi1],管[guan3]
to write down
to put pen to paper
to put pen to paper
writing brush of weasel bristle
to write a flawless essay in one go (idiom)/to be quick-witted and skilled at writing compositions
to transcribe/to make a fair copy
